fusilli.fusion_models.base_model.ParentFusionModelïƒ

class ParentFusionModel(pred_type, data_dims, params)[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

Parent class for all fusion models.

pred_typeïƒ

Type of prediction to be made. Options: binary, multiclass, regression.

Type:

str

mod1_dimïƒ

Dimension of modality 1.

Type:

int

mod2_dimïƒ

Dimension of modality 2.

Type:

int

img_dimïƒ

Dimensions of image modality. If using 2D images, then the dimensions will be (x, y). If using 3D images, then the dimensions will be (x, y, z).

Type:

tuple

paramsïƒ

Dictionary of parameters.

Type:

dict

multiclass_dimïƒ

Number of classes for multiclass prediction.

Type:

int

kfold_flagïƒ

Whether to use k-fold cross validation.

Type:

bool

final_predictionïƒ

Final prediction layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

mod1_layersïƒ

Modality 1 layers.

Type:

nn.ModuleDict

mod2_layersïƒ

Modality 2 layers.

Type:

nn.ModuleDict

img_layersïƒ

Image layers.

Type:

nn.ModuleDict

fused_layersïƒ

Fused layers.

Type:

nn.Sequential

set_final_pred_layers(input_dim=64)[source]ïƒ

Sets final prediction layers.

Parameters:

input_dim (int) â€“ Input dimension to final layers - may depend on fusion configuration.

Return type:

None

set_fused_layers(fused_dim)[source]ïƒ

Set layers for fused modality

Parameters:

fused_dim (int) â€“ Dimension of fused modality: how many features are there after fusion? e.g. if we have 2 modalities with 64 features each, and the fusion method was concatenation, the fused_dim would be 128

Return type:

None

set_img_layers()[source]ïƒ

Sets layers for image modality. If using 2D images, then the layers will use Conv2D layers. If using 3D images, then the layers will use Conv3D layers.

Parameters:

None â€“

Return type:

None
